resources.string: Solar System Planetinfo
Compare

Earth, our home planet, is the most amazing throughout the solar system because there is life here. It also cries out of it. We do not know if we are alone about it in the universe, but we do not know any other planet that is similar to the Earth.

Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system. It would accommodate approximately 1300 globes inside Jupiters surface. It also weighs more than all the other planets of the solar system together.
Distance from the Sun: \t About 778 million km
Jupiter: Distance from the Sun: \t About 778 million km

There is no planet that has tickled human imagination as much as Mars. Long into the 20th century, it was thought that Mars was inhabited. The "Marsians" also appeared in many books and movies, and were almost always evil.

Mercury is the planet closest to the sun. It is the smallest of the planets we can see in the night sky (the others are Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn). Because it is so close to the sun, it can be difficult to detect. It is best to look for the planet at dawn or dusk. Then it shines with a yellow-white shine.

Neptune is the eighth planet from the sun. It was actually not detected by being observed in a telescope, but by smart calculations.

Saturn is the second largest planet in the solar system, it is 800 times greater than the Earth. It is twice as far from the sun as Jupiter.

Uranus was the first planet discovered by looking at it in a telescope. It was the astronomer William Herschel (1738 to 1822) who first described it in 1781. Former astronomers thought the planet was a star.

Venus is the second planet from the sun and the hottest of all of them. Venus is almost as big as the Earth and is the planet closest to our world.
